pullRequest.body:
From sphere-eversion; I'm just upstreaming it.

Co-authored by: @PatrickMassot (original author)

---

- [x] depends on: #9674

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9674~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Could you move the import tweaks to another PR please?
Some loose ends remaining, but I think this would benefit from another look.
I have addressed all comments.

Thank you for the careful look; I have addressed all comments.
- I'm not convinced whether `eq_of_germ_isConstant_on` is too useful (happy to remove it if you prefer)
- I'm happy to hear suggestions where `Subring.orderedSubtype` could be placed.

Thanks again for the comments, which I have addressed.
awaiting-review
Can you fix the build by following the linter instructions?

Fixed the imports linter and merged master.
There's a freshly-generated `Subrings/Order.lean`; I could move the new material to that file instead. (Note that `Ordered.lean` has slightly heavier imports, though.)
awaiting-review
Update: Now it builds again, `lake exe shake` was a bit overzealous.
Yes, please move it to `Subring.Order`, it looks like a very good fit even if it means adding some imports there.
Thanks; updated. (CI has already passed the build and lint steps.)

bors r+
Thanks!

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8048574178/job/21980212130)
bors r-
bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8055736752/job/22003251088)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8056744812/job/22006455636)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8057296544/job/22008114433)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8057296544/job/22008114313)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8057296544/job/22008114047)

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

This already exists as [Filter.EventuallyEq.comp_tendsto](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Germ.html#Filter.EventuallyEq.comp_tendsto) (and I think the existing name is better, but that is debatable). It should absolutely be moved around here though

This could be defined for any filter, right? Of course you wouldn't have the distinguished value `x` so the proof might get slightly more complicated, but I think this is something that we want in general.
Good point. In fact, my new definition makes the proofs slightly *simpler*. :-)

These should be proved using [IsLocallyConstant.apply_eq_of_isPreconnected](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/LocallyConstant/Basic.html#IsLocallyConstant.apply_eq_of_isPreconnected), unless this is a too heavy import (which would be a shame)
I just tried this: for the first lemma, that's easy. I wouldn't mind a hand with the second one.
The second one is taking me further afield that I'd like: I've left a proof_wanted with some hints.

This looks a bit weird to me, as it seems like a very specialized combination of already existing facts. Is it useful for dot notation? Could you link some uses in the sphere eversion project so I see where it's useful?

All uses of `germ_congr{,_set}` are in [InductiveConstruction](https://github.com/leanprover-community/sphere-eversion/blob/master/SphereEversion/InductiveConstructions.lean). There are four places overall; it might be easiest to just use the search function.
I looked now: the one use of germ_congr is easy to inline. I would suggest I remove `germ_congr` and keep `germ_congr_set`. What do you think?
I inlined `germ_congr` into `germ_congr_set`.
This should use [Filter.Germ.liftOn](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Germ.html#Filter.Germ.liftOn) instead of `Quotient.liftOn'`

The proof should use [Filter.EventuallyEq.germ_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Germ.html#Filter.EventuallyEq.germ_eq) instead of `Quotient.sound`.

I'm also wondering wether this deserves a lemma, is `(h.comp_tendsto hÏ†).germ_eq` not short enough?
Good question! Let me look at sphere-eversion...
It is unused there. In other words: I don't have a strong opinion and am happy to delete this.

```suggestion
theorem isConstant_coe {l : Filter Î±} {b} (h : âˆ€ x', f x' = b) : (â†‘f : Germ l Î²).IsConstant :=
  âŸ¨b, eventually_of_forall (fun x â†¦ h x)âŸ© 
```

```suggestion
* `Filter.Germ.sliceLeft, sliceRight`: map the germ of functions `X Ã— Y â†’ Z` at `p = (x,y) âˆˆ X Ã— Y` 
to the corresponding germ of functions `X â†’ Z` at `x âˆˆ X` resp. `Y â†’ Z` at `y âˆˆ Y`..
```

```suggestion
/-- The map `Germ (ð“ x) E â†’ E` as a monoid homomorphism -/
@[to_additive "The map `Germ (ð“ x) E â†’ E` as an additive monoid homomorphism"]
```

```suggestion
/-- The map `Germ (ð“ x) E â†’ E` as a ring homomorphism -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The map `Germ (ð“ x) E â†’ E` as a monotone ring homomorphism -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Map the germ at of functions `X Ã— Y â†’ Z` at `p = (x, y) âˆˆ X Ã— Y` to the corresponding germ
```

```suggestion
/-- Map the germ at of functions `X Ã— Y â†’ Z` at `p = (x, y) âˆˆ X Ã— Y` to the corresponding germ
```

```suggestion
lemma isConstant_comp_tendsto {lc : Filter Î³} {g : Î³ â†’ Î±}
    (hf : (f : Germ l Î²).IsConstant) (hg : Tendsto g lc l) : IsConstant (f âˆ˜ g : Germ lc Î² ) := by
  rcases hf with âŸ¨b, hbâŸ©
  exact âŸ¨b, hb.comp_tendsto hgâŸ©

/-- If a germ `f : Germ l Î²` is constant, where `l : Filter Î±`,
and a function `g : Î³ â†’ Î±` tends to `l` along `lc : Filter Î³`,
the germ of the composition `f âˆ˜ g` is also constant. -/
lemma isConstant_compTendsto {f : Germ l Î²} {lc : Filter Î³} {g : Î³ â†’ Î±}
    (hf : f.IsConstant) (hg : Tendsto g lc l) : (f.compTendsto g hg).IsConstant := by
  rcases Quotient.exists_rep f with âŸ¨f, rflâŸ©
  exact isConstant_comp_tendsto hf hg
```
This one is now `isConstant_comp_tendsto hf continuousAt_subtype_val`. Maybe move it a few lines up, in the namespace `Filter.Germ`?
This one looks wrong. If `i` is the inclusion of a point in a space, say, then `f o i` is locally constant whatever the function `f`, but there is no reason why `f` itself should be locally constant.
Good point. I clearly went too far in extracting intermediate lemmas from `eq_of_germ_isConstant_on` (which *did* have a proof in sphere-eversion). Deleted.

```suggestion
theorem eq_of_germ_isConstant [i : PreconnectedSpace X]
```
This one is also wrong: you only have assumptions on `s`, you can not have a global conclusion.

```suggestion
    (hf : (f : Germ l Î²).IsConstant) (hg : Tendsto g lc l) : IsConstant (f âˆ˜ g : Germ lc Î²) := by
```
This lemma shouldn't be private, it could be useful more generally.

```suggestion
lemma eq_of_germ_isConstant_on {s : Set X} (h : âˆ€ x âˆˆ s, (f : Germ (ð“ x) Y).IsConstant)
    (hs : IsPreconnected s) {x' : X} (x_in : x âˆˆ s) (x'_in : x' âˆˆ s) : f x = f x' := by
  let i : s â†’ X := fun x â†¦ x
  show (f âˆ˜ i) (âŸ¨x, x_inâŸ© : s) = (f âˆ˜ i) (âŸ¨x', x'_inâŸ© : s)
  have : PreconnectedSpace s := Subtype.preconnectedSpace hs
  exact eq_of_germ_isConstant (fun y â†¦ Germ.isConstant_comp_subtype (h y y.2)) _ _
```
I would just create a new file `RingTheory.Subring.Ordered`.

```suggestion
def Subring.orderedSubtype {R} [OrderedRing R] (s : Subring R) : s â†’+*o R where
  __ := s.subtype 
  monotone' := fun _ _ h â†¦ h
```
is now the recommended spelling.

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.RingTheory.Subring.Ordered import Mathlib.RingTheory.Subring.Pointwise ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: lemmas about germs in topological spaces
